name: Progabide
Reason: Progabide is a complex molecule with multiple functional groups, which will impact its melting point. The basic unit for comparison can be the melting point of a simple aromatic compound, such as benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The phenyl groups in Progabide will increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the presence of a nitro group can increase the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and enhance molecular rigidity, contributing around +10 to +20°C. The fluorine atom can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to increase the molecular weight and rigidity, contributing around +5 to +10°C. The methyl group can lower the melting point due to its ability to reduce the molecular weight and increase the symmetry, contributing around -5 to -10°C. Finally, the presence of a sulfur atom can also impact the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and enhance molecular rigidity, contributing around +5 to +10°C.
